commit_message:
Heterogeneity comparisons and improved plotting

- Compare heterogeneity estimates from multiple sources for TCGA data.
- Faster re-runs by checking for presence of existing files
- Customization of plots to include separate plots for outputs of
  interest

Improve plots of sub-population comparisons

- Pre/post ordered correctly
- Allow specification of adjusted and unadjusted allele frequencies
- Details on sample counts in plots
- Improve resolution of violin plots
Provide plots by grouped samples genes by status

Generalize for multiple samples and new plots

- Include cohort, status and group information from external sources
  for plot preparation.
- Summarize results in CSV file for faster analysis and visualization.
- Generalize to support multiple samples with a python configuration
  input file.
Label known genes in frequency plots

Prioritize and group samples by driver genes

Run prioritization to retrieve changes in cancer associated variants
from CIViC. Organize and group allele frequencies by identified changes.

Heterogeneity: tumor-only frequency summaries

Organize VarDict and Seq2c results for tumor-only exome calls, plotting
frequency distributions, Tries to extract germline calls and focus on
somatic using presence in ExAC.
Convert Excel input files for COLO-289 and Horizon data into VCFs of validated regions for input into bcbio.variation
Summarize evaluation results for tumor-only prioritization
Scripts to evaluate tumor only calls and report concordance, discordance and extra calls
